pages.text: There are many different $(item)Weapons$() and $(item)Tools$() in the game that you can use to fight. $(br2)There are a few things to consider: $(br)$(li)Attack Damage $(li)Attack Speed $(li)Attack Cooldown $(li)Critical Hits $(li)Possible Enchantments

pages.title: Attack Cooldown
pages.text: When the $(thing)Player$() attacks too quickly, it reduces the strength of the attacks. $(br2)The base damage done (as a fraction of the full possible damage) depends on the time between attacks, which is also reflected in the height of the held $(item)Weapon$() on screen and the attack indicator bar

pages.title: Critical Hits
pages.text: A critical hit is an attack that deals extra damage compared to a regular attack. Critical melee strikes, regardless of the weapon used, cause small star particles to fly out of the target who was critically hit. $(item)Arrows$() shot from fully charged bows have a $(thing)25%$() chance of becoming critical. $(br2)In melee combat, a critical hit occurs when a $(thing)Player$() attacks a mob while falling, including while coming down from a jump, but not while jumping up. $(br)The attack deals $(thing)150%$() of the attack's base damage.
